meanings.definition: To watch over or supervise an examination.
meanings.sent1: During the test, the teacher was invigilating to ensure no one cheated.
meanings.sent2: The professor invigilated the exam to prevent any dishonest behavior.
meanings.sent3: The invigilating teacher caught a student trying to sneak a peek at their notes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like an invigilating hawk, keenly observing every move the students made.
meanings.sent5: The image of the teacher invigilating the exam was etched in the students' minds.

meanings.definition: To monitor or oversee a test.
meanings.sent1: The proctor was invigilating the exam to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent2: The supervisor invigilated the test to maintain order in the room.
meanings.sent3: While invigilating, the teacher accidentally knocked over a stack of papers.
meanings.sent4: The security camera invigilated the testing area, capturing every moment.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of invigilating the exam fell on the experienced teacher.

meanings.definition: To keep watch during an exam.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was invigilating the students during the final exam.
meanings.sent2: Parents were invited to invigilate the school exam to ensure transparency.
meanings.sent3: The invigilating proctor noticed a student nervously tapping their foot.
meanings.sent4: The clock seemed to be invigilating the students, ticking away the time.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the teacher invigilating the exam created a sense of security.
